statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Loyola, Md. 83, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 66
article.headline: Loyola, Md. 83, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 66
article.linkText: Loyola, Md. 83, Mount St. Mary's, Md. 66
article.story: BALTIMORE (AP) -- Marquis Sullivan scored 22 points to lead the Loyola Greyhounds past Mount St. Mary's, Md. 83-66 on Saturday. Michael Tuck had 16 points, Josko Alujevic added 13 points and Gerald Brown scored 12 points for the Greyhounds (4-2). The Mountaineers (1-6) had three players in double figures with Chris Vann scoring 12, Sam Atupem contributing 11 and Markus Mitchell adding 10. Loyola had the lead for most of the game. After halftime, the Mount could never get closer than 10. Tuck came off the bench to score 14 of his 16 points in a seven-minute stretch in the second half. The Greyhounds were leading 37-28 at halftime after a 11-2 run with 17 minutes remaining gave them the lead early in the game.
